FuncDef:
The twoway-jitter threshold command configures a two-way jitter alarm threshold.
The undo twoway-jitter threshold command cancels the two-way jitter alarm threshold.
By default, the two-way jitter alarm threshold is 10 milliseconds, and the alarm clearance threshold is 8 milliseconds.
CLIs: undo twoway-jitter threshold test-session <session-id> [ upper-limit <upper-limit> lower-limit <lower-limit> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a two-way jitter alarm threshold.
The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 1000, in milliseconds. The default value is 10.

Specifies a two-way jitter clear alarm threshold.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 999, in milliseconds. The default value is 8.

Specifies the ID of a test session.
For the X3 device, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3072.For the X8/X16 device, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8192.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a two-way jitter alarm threshold, run the twoway-jitter threshold command. The command output helps network administrators to adjust link bandwidth in time for service quality guarantee.
Prerequisites
A TWAMP Light test session has been created on the Control-Client.
